content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(2.5, 17.5)
– Burner inserter at Position(3.5, 17.5) placed at the factory interface
– Assembling machine at Position(1.5, 19.5)
– Additional burner inserter at Position(2.5, 16.5) supporting factory operations

### Depot Belt System at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– Wooden chest at Position(3.5, 15.5) serving as the belt depot
– Transport belt segment at Position(4.5, 15.5) placed adjacent to the depot
– Depot burner inserter at Position(3.5, 14.5) that connects the depot via its pickup position

### Isolated Belt Depot at Position(-4.5, 18.5)
Consists of:
– Wooden chest at Position(-4.5, 18.5) placed as an isolated belt target

### Extraction System at Position(-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– Extraction system burner inserter at Position(-3.5, 27.5) with drop position Position(-3.5, 28.5)

### Electricity Generator at Position(-0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
– Steam engine (generator) at Position(-0.5, 24.5)
– Boiler at Position(-5.5, 24.0)
– Offshore pump at Position(-7.5, 25.5)

### Stone Furnace at Position(-3.0, 19.0)
Consists of:
– Stone furnace at Position(-3.0, 19.0) used for smelting (producing iron-plate)

### Stone Furnace at Position(-4.0, 21.0)
Consists of:
– Stone furnace at Position(-4.0, 21.0) used for smelting (producing copper-plate)

### Laboratory (Position not specified)
Consists of:
– Lab with input {‘automation-science-pack’: 17} and electrical_id=7106; currently not receiving power

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
  When connecting transport belts, ensure the target entity is an inserter rather than a steam engine. Always add an inserter to serve as the input interface to receive items.

• Placement Distance Error  
  Before placing an entity, verify that the player is within the maximum allowed distance from the target position. Move closer if the distance exceeds the placement limit.

• Variable Naming Error  
  Use consistent, defined variable names (for example, ensuring that target_chest is properly defined) to avoid NameError issues.

• Inventory Availability Error  
  Confirm that the required items (such as a wooden chest) are available in the inventory before attempting to place them.
